title: p-variation
summary: In mathematical analysis, p-variation is a collection of seminorms on functions from an ordered set to a metric space, indexed by a real number p ≥ 1 {\displaystyle p\geq 1} . p-variation is a measure of the regularity or smoothness of a function. Specifically, if f : I → ( M , d ) {\displaystyle f:I\to (M,d)} , where ( M , d ) {\displaystyle (M,d)} is a metric space and I a totally ordered set, its p-variation is
